abstract: Pedro Hernandez's confession to 1979 murder of 6-year-old Etan Patz presents challenges for both prosecution and defense as trial gets under way; while a confession usually ensures a conviction, Hernandez's mental disability casts doubt on veracity of his story in case absent of any other evidence.
lead_paragraph: The prosecution must convict Pedro Hernandez of the 6-year-old’s 1979 murder almost entirely on his own words, and the defense must convince a jury that his videotaped confessions were fiction.
snippet: The prosecution must convict Pedro Hernandez of the 6-year-old’s 1979 murder almost entirely on his own words, and the defense must convince a jury that his videotaped confessions were fiction.

headline.main: In Etan Patz Case, High Hurdles for Prosecutors and Defense
headline.print_headline: In Patz Case, High Hurdles for Prosecutors and Defense
